newsitem.title: KENYA: $1.6 million stolen in Kenya's worst bank theft.
newsitem.headline: $1.6 million stolen in Kenya's worst bank theft.

text.p: Six armed robbers stole $1.64 million from Standard Chartered Bank Kenya Ltd on Tuesday in Kenyas biggest ever bank robbery.
Six thieves took $900,000 and 40 million shillings ($740,700) after entering through a staff entrance before opening hours, said bank spokesman Juma Muiru.
"They pointed guns at the guards and ordered to be taken to the strongroom. It was a very panicky situation, no one looked at the robbers," Muiru said.
Muiru said the bank, robbed twice last year for up to $22,200, wrote to the commissioner of police last July to express concern over security.
"This confirms our fears. This type of thing affects the investment climate. Authorities must do something about security," he said.
